description: Rada Miskovic reviews both the Echo Protocol and Halden's confessional video, weighing the impact of each on Stenograd's volatile state. She decides to broadcast only the Echo Protocol, believing it offers a path to stability.
Echo Protocol quietly activates on city screens and devices, sending calm guidance and prompts for collaboration instead of BCI-driven commands. Citizens are encouraged to organize locally.

Self-organization takes hold across neighborhoods: resources and responsibilities are shared based on trust, not scores. Former BCI divisions dissolve as new, adaptive communities emerge, often outside Council control.
Innovators uncover an embedded message in the Echo Protocol revealing Halden foresaw the BCI collapse and intended a transition to collective civic action.
The Council—unable to override the protocol—publicly acknowledges the new community-led order. Citizens celebrate the end of BCI governance and reclaim public spaces.
